cards.name: Academy Ruins
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}, {T}: Put target artifact card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor: Its secrets once wrought the greatest artifice ever known. Now crabs loot the rubble to decorate their shells.

cards.name: Æther Web
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1, has reach, and can block creatures with shadow as though they didn't have shadow. (Creatures with reach can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Ætherflame Wall
cards.text:
Defender
Ætherflame Wall can block creatures with shadow as though they didn't have shadow.
{R}: Ætherflame Wall gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Amrou Scout
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The people of Amrou were scattered by war and driven into hiding. Scouts maintain the beacon fires that signal "return" and "home."

cards.name: Amrou Seekers
cards.text: Amrou Seekers can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.
cards.flavor: The paradise of Amrou Haven had become a field of cinders. Its people struggled to survive, hoping to see visions of its past in the strange storms that quickly passed.

cards.name: Ancestral Vision
cards.text:
Suspend 4—{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {U} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
Target player draws three cards.

cards.name: Ancient Grudge
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: The time rifts remind Yavimaya of the enemies of its past and provide fresh fuel for its fires.

cards.name: Angel's Grace
cards.text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
You can't lose the game this turn and your opponents can't win the game this turn. Until end of turn, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

cards.name: Ashcoat Bear
cards.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
cards.flavor: The bears wade into time rifts to feed. They do not fear the storms, and they are quick enough to snatch prey just as it blinks in or out of time.

cards.name: Aspect of Mongoose
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
When Aspect of Mongoose is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Aspect of Mongoose to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: The rulers of old Dominaria kept assassins on retainer. However, the true loyalty of these master killers was always to their peers. This elite brotherhood survived the fall of the old royal order.

cards.name: Assembly-Worker
cards.text: {T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: With their factories long destroyed, some of Mishra's creations still toil in remote areas, endlessly performing and reperforming their last orders.

cards.name: Barbed Shocker
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Whenever Barbed Shocker deals damage to a player, that player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.
cards.flavor: Fervid shamans willingly submit to shockers in hopes of glimpsing the fortunes of the future.

cards.name: Basal Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "Sacrifice this permanent: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool."
cards.flavor:
"Fascinating . . . These creatures display the paradox of tenacity and purposed self-destruction I have sought to breed into my thrulls."
—Endrek Sahr, master breeder

cards.name: Basalt Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying
Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{R}: Basalt Gargoyle gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Benalish Cavalry
cards.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "My people swore to protect Benalia to the end. It is battered, but yet stands, as do we."

cards.name: Bewilder
cards.text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Teferi snapped his fingers, and the viashino started clucking like a chicken. Silly, yes, but exactly the thing we needed to break the stifling tension."
—Jhoira, master artificer

cards.name: Blazing Blade Askari
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{2}: Blazing Blade Askari becomes colorless until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "This can't be Jamuraa. We could not have failed her this badly . . . ."

cards.name: Bogardan Hellkite
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Bogardan Rager
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Bogardan Rager enters the battlefield, target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In the erupting heart of Bogardan, it's hard to tell hurtling volcanic rocks from pouncing volcanic beasts.

cards.name: Bonesplitter Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures get +2/+0.
cards.flavor: As the time streams grew more and more unstable, Dominaria's creatures struggled to adapt. The intense pressures led to many dead ends but also to lethal new forms that appeared as suddenly as the ashen rains.

cards.name: Brass Gnat
cards.text:
Flying
Brass Gnat doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Gnat.
cards.flavor: Its buzzing is the sound of its inner mechanisms, ever winding down.

cards.name: Brine Elemental
cards.text:
Morph {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Brine Elemental is turned face up, each opponent skips his or her next untap step.
cards.flavor: Water calls to water, and the world is left exhausted and withered in its wake.

cards.name: Calciform Pools
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Calciform Pools.
{1}, Remove X storage counters from Calciform Pools: Add X mana in any combination of {W} and/or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Call to the Netherworld
cards.text:
Return target black creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Madness {0} (If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)
cards.flavor: The ritual was normally performed only by horrors and pit spawn. Lesser mages had but one sanity to crack in the casting.

cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: Fendros gasped as he watched the spell drip from the ends of his fingers. He moved his foot, afraid to disturb the spot where it lay slain.

cards.name: Candles of Leng
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it has the same name as a card in your graveyard, put it into your graveyard. Otherwise, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"A tome stored in its light is as crisp as the day it was written."
—Ettovard, Tolarian archivist

cards.name: Careful Consideration
cards.text: Target player draws four cards, then discards three cards. If you cast this spell during your main phase, instead that player draws four cards, then discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Sages who take the time to verify their sources are rewarded for their diligence."
—Jhoira, to Teferi

cards.name: Castle Raptors
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Castle Raptors is untapped, it gets +0/+2.
cards.flavor: "Each place we see is as ruined and lifeless as the last. So here we stay, because this ruin is ours."

cards.name: Cavalry Master
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Other creatures you control with flanking have flanking. (Each instance of flanking triggers separately.)

cards.name: Celestial Crusader
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Flying
Other white creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Chameleon Blur
cards.text: Prevent all damage that creatures would deal to players this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Sometimes the best plan is neither fighting nor running."
—Freyalise

cards.name: Children of Korlis
cards.text: Sacrifice Children of Korlis: You gain life equal to the life you've lost this turn. (Damage causes loss of life.)
cards.flavor:
"We have a proud history of self-sacrifice. But it is easy, in these bleak times, to find one among us who is eager to die for any cause."
—Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

cards.name: Chromatic Star
cards.text:
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Star: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
When Chromatic Star is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"This item is not from . . . now. It reflects a sky no longer ours and gleams with hope that does not exist."
—Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

cards.name: Chronatog Totem
cards.text:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}: Chronatog Totem becomes a 1/2 blue Atog artifact creature until end of turn.
{0}: Chronatog Totem gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn and only if Chronatog Totem is a creature.

cards.name: Chronosavant
cards.text: {1}{W}: Return Chronosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped. You skip your next turn.
cards.flavor: "In my dreams, I hear the voices of my future selves who have died in times yet to come. I use that knowledge to avoid those dark futures and continue my search for peace."

cards.name: Clockspinning
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Choose a counter on target permanent or suspended card. Remove that counter from that permanent or card or put another of those counters on it.

cards.text:
Clockwork Hydra enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Clockwork Hydra attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it. If you do, Clockwork Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Cloudchaser Kestrel
cards.text:
Flying

{W}: Target permanent becomes white until end of turn.

cards.name: Coal Stoker

cards.flavor:
"The day is mine! I sent three such creatures against my foe, then watched as my magefire popped her soldiers like overripe spleenfruits."
—Dobruk the Unstable, pyromancer

cards.name: Conflagrate
cards.text:
Conflagrate deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Flashback—{R}{R}, Discard X cards. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

Morph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Coral Trickster is turned face up, you may tap or untap target permanent.

cards.name: Corpulent Corpse
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Suspend 5—{B} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {B} and exile it with five time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

cards.name: Cyclopean Giant
cards.text: When Cyclopean Giant dies, target land becomes a Swamp. Exile Cyclopean Giant.
cards.flavor: A tomb-eye may remain shut for centuries. It opens when it sees a world as twisted and hollow as the wretch beneath its lid.

cards.name: D'Avenant Healer
cards.text:
{T}: D'Avenant Healer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: "One arrow keenly fired might prevent more battlefield wounds than I could treat."

cards.name: Dark Withering
cards.text:
Destroy target nonblack creature.
Madness {B} (If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Deathspore Thallid
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Deathspore Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Deathspore Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Deep-Sea Kraken
cards.text:
Deep-Sea Kraken can't be blocked.
Suspend 9—{2}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{U} and exile it with nine time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, if Deep-Sea Kraken is suspended, remove a time counter from it.

cards.name: Dementia Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{T}: Name a card. Target opponent reveals a card at random from his or her hand. If it's the named card, that player discards it. Activate this ability only during your turn."

cards.text:
Buyback—Discard two cards. (You may discard two cards in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Detainment Spell
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be activated.
{1}{W}: Attach Detainment Spell to target creature.
cards.flavor: Bind the mind rather than the wrist, and you stop the intent to harm before it starts.

cards.name: Divine Congregation
cards.text:
You gain 2 life for each creature target player controls.
Suspend 5—{1}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W} and exile it with five time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying

If damage would be dealt to Dralnu, Lich Lord, sacrifice that many permanents instead.

cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Flashback—Sacrifice three creatures. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Dreadship Reef
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Dream Stalker
cards.text: When Dream Stalker enters the battlefield, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: What happens when it is the dream that wakes and the sleeper that fades into memory?

cards.name: Drifter il-Dal
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Drifter il-Dal unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: They study the deeds of their traitorous ancestors, hoping the stories may reveal a way back to the physical world.

cards.name: Drudge Reavers
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
{B}: Regenerate Drudge Reavers.
cards.flavor:
"The surface of the land is blanched with salt, but the soil beneath is reddened with death—a fertile ground for necromancy."
—Lim-Dûl the Necromancer

cards.name: Durkwood Baloth
cards.text: Suspend 5—{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {G} and exile it with five time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

cards.name: Duskrider Peregrine
cards.text:
Flying, protection from black
Suspend 3—{1}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

cards.name: Empty the Warrens
cards.text:
Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
cards.flavor:
"They'd pour out of the warrens to make war (and to make room for the littering matrons)."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

cards.name: Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a creature spell, put X 1/1 black Thrull creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.
When you control seven or more Thrulls, sacrifice Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder.

cards.name: Errant Doomsayers
cards.text: {T}: Tap target creature with toughness 2 or less.
cards.flavor: "Heed my words, traveler. Plagues, war, desolation . . . all mere hints of what is yet to come from Dominaria's vault of horrors."

cards.name: Errant Ephemeron
cards.text:
Flying
Suspend 4—{1}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{U} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

Enchant creature

Gain control of target creature of an opponent's choice he or she controls.

cards.text:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.
Whenever Evil Eye of Urborg becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.
cards.flavor: "Edahlis, what is that thing? We should have stayed in Yavimaya . . . ." —Aznaph, greenseeker

Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

Enchant creature

cards.text:
Morph—Return two Islands you control to their owner's hand. (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Fathom Seer is turned face up, draw two cards.

cards.name: Feebleness
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
cards.flavor: Just a small touch of magic can harness the debilitating power of Urborg's poisonous winds.

cards.flavor:
"They are here, and they are hungry. And what they do not eat, they burn. Yavimaya is lost. We must leave now for Skyshroud."
—Edahlis, greenseeker

cards.name: Flagstones of Trokair
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

Flying
{T}: Fledgling Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

Flying
{3}{W}: Exile Flickering Spirit, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Flowstone Channeler
cards.text: {1}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: With the evincars gone, flowstone became erratic and wild, a source of power for mages more desperate than wise.

cards.name: Fool's Demise

Enchant creature

cards.flavor:
"Where metal is tainted and wood is scarce, we are best armed by faith."
—Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

cards.name: Fortune Thief
cards.text:
Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
Morph {R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

"When a sliver of this breed enters the hive, the others claw each other in frenzied fits, thereby ensuring their rapid growth."
—Rukarumel, field journal

cards.name: Gemhide Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
cards.flavor:
"The land is weary. Even Skyshroud is depleted. We must find another source of mana—one that is growing despite our withering world."
—Freyalise

cards.flavor:
